intro: Satureja kuntzeana, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pink or purple flowers in the summer. Its leaves are fragrant and used in traditional herbal medicine for their digestive and antispasmodic properties. Satureja kuntzeana thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to alpine gardens.
